# Récupération et traitement des données de spotify

Les sources des documents proviennent du téléchargement sur le site Kaggle.com, le lien des jeux de données sont:
https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/salvatorerastelli/spotify-and-youtube
```{r}
  spotifyDataPath <- "./Spotify_Youtube.csv"
  data <- read.csv(spotifyDataPath, header=TRUE, stringsAsFactors=FALSE, nrows=50)
  ggplot(data_clean, aes(x = Energy, y = Loudness)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  theme_bw() + 
  labs(title = "Relation entre Energy et Loudness", x = "Energy", y = "Loudness") +
  scale_x_continuous(limits = c(0, 1), breaks = seq(0, 1, 0.1)) +
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(-30, 0), breaks = seq(-30, 0, 5))

  ggplot(data_clean, aes(x = Energy, y = Stream, color = "Stream")) + 
  geom_point() + 
  theme_bw() + 
  labs(title = "Relation entre Energy et Stream", x = "Energy", y = "Stream") +
  scale_x_continuous(limits = c(0, 1), breaks = seq(0, 1, 0.1)) +
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0, 50000000), breaks = seq(0, 50000000, 10000000)) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("Stream" = "blue"))
```
